Package trashday.model

Implements the Calendar object that stores the user's regular pickup schedule.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Calendar
    Data structure for a regular pickup schedule.
    CalendarEvent
    Data structure for the recurring iCal events in the regular pickup schedule.
    DateTimeUtils
    Helper functions that address gaps and inconsistencies among the various date/time components in early Java, ical4j's work-arounds, and Java 8.
    IntentLog
    Data structure for storing user activity log.
    NextPickups
    Data structure to compute the next pickup times for every pickup in a schedule that occurs after a given datetime.
    Schedule Deprecated
    TimeOfWeek Deprecated
    ToCurrentIntentLog
    Handles converting from old versions of the IntentLog class during deserialization.
    ToCurrentSchedule Deprecated
    ToCurrentTimeOfWeek Deprecated

Package trashday.model Description

Implements the Calendar object that stores the user's regular pickup schedule. Also provides classes to enable version-controlled de-serialization to allow for update of the Schedules stored in Dynamo DB in the event that a later application update requires an update to the model structure.

It's important to note that the model is built to work with Java 8's new Date and Time classes. Specifically, the data storage of user pickup schedule (both Schedule and Calendar) information is stored *without* embedded time zone information. This is useful in an Alexa Skills environment as the application does not run the user's timezone. All skills run in UTC timezone.

Author:
J. Todd Baldwin
See Also:
Jackson Module: Model Versioning, Java SE 8 Date and Time
